summary: Joseph S. Piccolo was a CIA employee who resigned on October 4, 1961. Prior to his resignation, he received cover debriefing instructions to maintain a cover story regarding his employment and travel history. Later, his military cover backstop was cancelled effective June 11, 1963, and all military documentation was to be returned. In 1968, he was an Operations Officer and a request was made for a Permanent Change of Station (PCS) overseas evaluation for him to be reassigned from Managua, Nicaragua, to JMCOBRA. His official personnel folder contains records of promotions, reassignments, and a notice of an official disability claim file.
significance: The documents indicate that Joseph S. Piccolo was a CIA employee involved in operations, including overseas assignments. His role in the JFK assassination context is not explicitly stated in these documents, but his CIA affiliation and operational experience could be relevant depending on further information.
